name: Migas
description: Migas are breakfast nachos! They are a playful twist on scrambled eggs loaded with cheese, crunchy peppers, and crushed tortilla chips. Eggs are full of protein and healthy fats for a hearty start to your day. And, this recipe is a great way to use up leftover chips—in fact, the staler, the better for absorbing all the luscious flaves.
preparation: Heat oil in Sauté Pan over medium-high heat. Add peppers and 1 tbsp seasoning; stir often, until soft, about 4 min.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk eggs with remaining seasoning.
Reduce heat to medium; add eggs to pan. Stir frequently until eggs are creamy and just set, about 2-3 min. Crumble in tortilla chips, cheese and salsa; stir to combine. Top with avocado, if desired.
tips: Swap in 2 tbsp Poco Picante Salsa Mix for Spanish Rice Seasoning. Spanish Rice Seasoning offers a more mild, rounded flavour, whereas Poco Picante Salsa Mix offers something spicier.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with a slice of toast or 1⁄2 cup roasted potatoes.

products.name: Spanish Rice Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: Spanish Rice, or arroz rojo, is the taco night sidekick you’ve been waiting for! Ready in just 20 minutes, it pairs well with tacos, enchiladas, and Chicken Barbacoa. It’s a great filling for tasty burritos with the flavour of fresh tomato, oregano, cumin, and coriander. No need to buy and chop tomatoes and onions—follow the foolproof, one-pot recipe on the back of the pack for perfect rice every time.

products.name: Poco Picante Salsa Mix
summary: The vibrant flavours of cayenne, chilies, and garlic come together to create a zesty salsa with a medium kick.

products.name: Sauté Pan
summary: An all-purpose pan to brown, sauté, and simmer—ideal for one pan meals.

products.name: Poco Picante Salsa Mix
summary: The vibrant flavours of cayenne, chilies, and garlic come together to create a zesty salsa with a medium kick.
